Sentencas: The selection of the components is important for the solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC) in order to address the sealing issues.
Titulo: Thermal stress simulation and chemical compatibility of glass composite seals with YSZ for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In the present investigation, the glass composite seals have been prepared by mixing the different glass compositions in fixed ratio and then ball milling for 5h without using any unreactive particle in glass matrix.
Titulo: Thermal stress simulation and chemical compatibility of glass composite seals with YSZ for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The chemical compatibility of the prepared glass composites with the solid electrolyte yttria stabilized zirconia (YSZ) has been studied using the scanning electron microscope (SEM) and dot-mapping techniques.
Titulo: Thermal stress simulation and chemical compatibility of glass composite seals with YSZ for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The interfacial study has revealed that all the glass composites except GG5 have shown good adhesion along with no undesired chemical reaction at the interfaces.
Titulo: Thermal stress simulation and chemical compatibility of glass composite seals with YSZ for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Furthermore, the thermal stress generated within the glass composite/YSZ diffusion couple has been simulated for 10000h heat-treatment at 800 degrees C along with its magnitude using the COMSOL multiphysics analysis.
Titulo: Thermal stress simulation and chemical compatibility of glass composite seals with YSZ for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Interestingly, for all the diffusion couples, the stress is within the acceptable limit, but for the GG5 composite/YSZ couple, the stress varies between 6 and 529N/m(2).
Titulo: Thermal stress simulation and chemical compatibility of glass composite seals with YSZ for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In addition to this, for the GG5 composite/YSZ couple, the interface exhibits a high stress zone, which shows good correlation with the microstructural analysis.
Titulo: Thermal stress simulation and chemical compatibility of glass composite seals with YSZ for solid oxide fuel cells
Thermal stress simulation and chemical compatibility of glass composite seals with YSZ for solid oxide fuel cells
